cols.desc: AMQP request command

cols.desc: AMQP request for request class_id

cols.desc: AMQP request for request method_id

datatableDocs.name: conn_stats
datatableDocs.desc: Connection-level stats. This table contains statistics on the communications made between client-server pairs. For network-level information such as RX/TX errors and drops, see the Network-Layer Stats (network_stats) table.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: remote_addr
cols.desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: remote_port
cols.desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: trace_role
cols.desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

cols.name: addr_family
cols.desc: The socket address family of the connection.

cols.name: protocol
cols.desc: The protocol of the traffic on the connections.

cols.name: ssl
cols.desc: Was SSL traffic detected on this connection.

cols.name: conn_open
cols.desc: The number of connections opened since the beginning of tracing.

cols.name: conn_close
cols.desc: The number of connections closed since the beginning of tracing.

cols.name: conn_active
cols.desc: The number of active connections

cols.name: bytes_sent
cols.desc: The number of bytes sent to the remote endpoint(s).

cols.name: bytes_recv
cols.desc: The number of bytes received from the remote endpoint(s).

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: remote_addr

cols.name: trace_role
cols.desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

cols.name: req_body
cols.desc: Request body

cols.desc: Response opcode

cols.name: resp_body
cols.desc: Request body

cols.name: latency
cols.desc: Request-response latency.

cols.desc: Response header

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: remote_addr
cols.desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: remote_port
cols.desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: trace_role
cols.desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

cols.name: major_version
cols.desc: HTTP major version, can be 1 or 2

cols.name: minor_version
cols.desc: HTTP minor version, HTTP1 uses 1, HTTP2 set this value to 0

cols.name: content_type
cols.desc: Type of the HTTP payload, can be JSON or protobuf

cols.name: req_headers
cols.desc: Request headers in JSON format

cols.name: req_method
cols.desc: HTTP request method (e.g. GET, POST, ...)

cols.name: req_path
cols.desc: Request path

cols.name: req_body
cols.desc: Request body in JSON format

cols.name: req_body_size
cols.desc: Request body size (before any truncation)

cols.name: resp_headers
cols.desc: Response headers in JSON format

cols.name: resp_status
cols.desc: HTTP response status code

cols.name: resp_message
cols.desc: HTTP response status text (e.g. OK, Not Found, ...)

cols.name: resp_body
cols.desc: Response body in JSON format

cols.name: resp_body_size
cols.desc: Response body size (before any truncation)

cols.name: latency
cols.desc: Request-response latency.

datatableDocs.name: jvm_stats
datatableDocs.desc: Basic JVM memory management metrics for java processes. Includes information about memory use and garbage collection.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: young_gc_time
cols.desc: Young generation garbage collection time in nanoseconds.

cols.name: full_gc_time
cols.desc: Full garbage collection time in nanoseconds.

cols.name: used_heap_size
cols.desc: Used heap size in bytes.

cols.name: total_heap_size
cols.desc: Total heap size in bytes.

cols.name: max_heap_size
cols.desc: Maximal heap capacity in bytes.

datatableDocs.name: network_stats
datatableDocs.desc: Network-layer RX/TX stats, grouped by pod. This table contains aggregate statistics measured at the network device interface. For connection-level information, including the remote endpoints with which a pod is communicating, see the Connection-Level Stats (conn_stats) table.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: pod_id
cols.desc: The ID of the pod

cols.name: rx_bytes
cols.desc: Received network traffic in bytes of the pod

cols.name: rx_packets
cols.desc: Number of received network packets of the pod

cols.name: rx_errors
cols.desc: Number of network receive errors of the pod

cols.name: rx_drops
cols.desc: Number of dropped network packets being received of the pod

cols.name: tx_bytes
cols.desc: Transmitted network traffic of the pod

cols.name: tx_packets
cols.desc: Number of transmitted network packets of the pod

cols.name: tx_errors
cols.desc: Number of network transmit errors of the pod

cols.name: tx_drops
cols.desc: Number of dropped network packets being transmitted of the pod

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: remote_addr
cols.desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: remote_port
cols.desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: trace_role
cols.desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

cols.name: req_cmd
cols.desc: PostgreSQL request command code

cols.name: req
cols.desc: PostgreSQL request body

cols.name: resp
cols.desc: PostgreSQL response body

cols.name: latency
cols.desc: Request-response latency.

datatableDocs.name: probe_status
datatableDocs.desc: This table contains the deployment status of eBPF probes in different Stirling source connectors and the error messages if deployment failed

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: source_connector
cols.desc: The source connector whose status is reported

cols.name: tracepoint
cols.desc: The tracepoint in the source connector of interest

cols.name: status
cols.desc: The status of the deployment or event

cols.name: error
cols.desc: The error messages of the deployment or event, if any

cols.name: info
cols.desc: Optional extra info provided as a JSON

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: exit_code
cols.desc: The exit code of this process.

cols.name: signal
cols.desc: The signal received by this process.

cols.name: comm
cols.desc: The name of this process.

datatableDocs.name: process_stats
datatableDocs.desc: CPU, memory and IO stats for all K8s processes in your cluster.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: major_faults
cols.desc: Number of major page faults

cols.name: minor_faults
cols.desc: Number of minor page faults

cols.name: cpu_utime_ns
cols.desc: Time spent on user space by the process

cols.name: cpu_ktime_ns
cols.desc: Time spent on kernel by the process

cols.name: num_threads
cols.desc: Number of threads of the process

cols.name: vsize_bytes
cols.desc: Virtual memory size in bytes of the process

cols.name: rss_bytes
cols.desc: Resident memory size in bytes of the process

cols.name: rchar_bytes
cols.desc: IO reads in bytes of the process

cols.name: wchar_bytes
cols.desc: IO writes in bytes of the process

cols.name: read_bytes
cols.desc: IO reads actually go to storage layer in bytes of the process

cols.name: write_bytes
cols.desc: IO writes actually go to storage layer in bytes of the process

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: remote_addr
cols.desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: remote_port
cols.desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

cols.name: trace_role
cols.desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

cols.name: req_cmd
cols.desc: Request command. See https://redis.io/commands.

cols.name: req_args
cols.desc: Request command arguments.

cols.name: resp
cols.desc: Response message.

cols.name: latency
cols.desc: Request-response latency.

datatableDocs.name: stack_traces.beta
datatableDocs.desc: Sampled stack traces of applications that identify hot-spots in application code. Executable symbols are required for human-readable function names to be displayed.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: stack_trace_id
cols.desc: A unique identifier of the stack trace, for script-writing convenience. String representation is in the `stack_trace` column.

cols.name: stack_trace
cols.desc: A stack trace within the sampled process, in folded format. The call stack symbols are separated by semicolons. If symbols cannot be resolved, addresses are populated instead.

cols.name: count
cols.desc: Number of times the stack trace has been sampled.

datatableDocs.name: stirling_error
datatableDocs.desc: This table contains the status of tracepoints in different Stirling source connectors and the error messages.

cols.name: time_
cols.desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

cols.name: source_connector
cols.desc: The source connector whose status is reported

cols.name: status
cols.desc: The status of the deployment or event

cols.name: error
cols.desc: The error messages of the deployment or event, if any

cols.name: context
cols.desc: The context in which the error occurred
